title: 112_s3531
content: Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property. Expansion of credit for hydrogen-related alternative fuel vehicle refueling property, including an increase in the credit percentage to 50% for hydrogen-related property and removing the dollar limitation for such property. Additionally, the credit is allowable for refueling property for certain motor vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads. The paragraph expands the definition of specified off-highway vehicles for the purpose of the subsection, including all motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads regardless of the type of load or material. The definition of specified off-highway vehicles is expanded to include all motor-propelled vehicles designed for carrying or towing loads, excluding certain equipment and vehicles operating exclusively on rails. Additionally, the credit for hydrogen property is extended through 2016. The amendments made by this Act apply to property placed in service after the enactment date, with specific dates for different types of property. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells. Increased investment credit for more efficient fuel cells, with a 50% credit for qualified fuel cell property in a combined heat and power system with an energy efficiency of 70% or more, and a 40% credit for systems with an energy efficiency of at least 60% but less than 70%. The text chunk discusses amendments to the tax code related to the investment credit for qualified fuel cell property. The amendments include changes to the maximum credit and limitations for fuel cell property placed in service during the taxable year. The amendments made to the tax code limit the investment credit for qualified fuel cell property based on capacity, with different amounts for different types of property. These changes apply to taxable years starting after the enactment of the Act.
